resources.string:
Measure
 1. Point your camera to the sky away from any light sources, including the Moon.

2. Press "MEASURE".

3. Three readings are taken and then averaged.

4. Surface brightness of the sky is calculated.

 Calibrate
 Dark Frame
 1. Cover the lens of the camera as completely as possible. We recommend putting it inside a bag or box.
 2. Press "MEASURE".
 3. Three readings are taken and then averaged.
 4. Sum of pixel values are recorded to be used in measurement.
 Moon
 1. Point the camera to the Moon.
 2. Press "MEASURE".
 3. Readings will only be taken if the "Max" value is less than 255. To prevent pixel saturation, jiggle your phone to smear the light to more pixels.
 4. Three valid readings will be recorded and used in the calculation of the zero point.
